intro: Pentacalia batallonensis, commonly known as the Batallon's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
